headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: CNN New Year's Eve. Aired 5-6p ET

utterances.speaker: LAURA COATES, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Fireworks displays all around the world. I'm Laura Coates in London. Boris Sanchez is in Paris. Let's go to Eleni as Athens is counting down to the New Year as we speak. Eleni.

utterances.speaker: ELENI GIOKOS, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, we've got about a minute to go. And as you can see, thousands of people behind me at the Stavros Niarchos Cultural Center. So people already going on with the fireworks. It's so exciting. Countdown is about to start in Greek.I'm going to count with them. Pende, tesserae, tria, do, ena, Xronia polla. Happy New Year. Look at this. Wow. This is a wonderful cultural heritage that we have bringing in the New Year. I wish everyone a beautiful 2025 from Athens, Greece. All the magic in the world. (SINGING)

utterances.speaker: GIOKOS
utterances.sentences: And as you can see, we brought it into the year. The New Year 2025. Incredible display of fireworks. And let me tell you, I can feel the energy.You know, one of the things we always say is xronia polla is many years we wish people health and of course, incredible success. And one of the fun things that we is we have a little triangle, just the middle of the triangle. And we say, xronia polla. And there's a little song that goes with it, (FOREIGN LANGUAGE). And I would sing the whole song for you, but then you'd have to pay me money because that's what kids do around the city of Athens and in all cities and villages across the country. So I'm not going to sing the whole song for you because then you'll owe me a lot of cash.

utterances.speaker: BORIS SANCHEZ, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: We'll put a check in the mail to Eleni Giokos' slide for us in Athens.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on, Eleni.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It's so fascinating to see so many different --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: That was great.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: -- which you actually match with, we should point out --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: -- to here in Paris, France. There is an enormous crowd on the Champs Elysees with the Arc de Triomphe behind me lit up. We were expecting almost a million of our closest friends to be here all around this central borough fair. As we listen to live music, we watch the strobe lights, these projectors that have been set up on the Arc de Triomphe. And as soon as the clock hits midnight in less than an hour, just about 50 minutes from now, we're expecting an exciting fireworks show and it will rival some of what you've seen around the world.So please stay tuned for that. You are not going to want to miss it. Right now we've got Colin Hay from Australian rock band Men at Work performing who "Can It Be Now," a hit that you and I love from the early 1980s. Take it away.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to CNN's special New Year's Eve coverage. We're checking Paris to ring in the New Year in just a few moments. We're all expecting a tremendous light show right here in London. We've got a lot ahead for you. Our performance by the Notre Dame choir.We've also got a performance by Al Green, everyone. And you don't want to miss this, a live interview with NBA superstar Jayson Tatum. Oh, I can't wait for that. Listen, you can't separate New Year's Eve traditions from food. Math. No different. Either you're in New York or you're right here in London. Isa Soares is here with me.

utterances.speaker: ISA SOARES, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I've changed.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: It's no longer her. It's now Harry Potter.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) has gone. Elizabeth the first has gone expelliarmus, Laura. Actually, stay here. Don't go anywhere.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh my God.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: We need you. About 400 years after Queen Elizabeth, you have another great icon, right?

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You have committed and I love it.SOARES Dude, I'm expecting you to commit to this because --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: To what? To what?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait. I know a great banquet. The Great hall of Hogwarts, I've got some yummy food for you.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh my God.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Some traditions. Thank you, Brooke (ph). This is fish and chips.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: A bouquet.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: A bouquet of fish and chips.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: My favorite. A fried bouquet.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Look, interesting fact here for everyone watching, this was the only --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Smells good.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: -- food that was not rationed during the Second World War.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: To boost morale. So you've got fish, you got chips. Go for it. Look, I'm committing. I expect her to commit right now.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I'm hungry.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Cold chips. How's that? Good? You like it?So, whilst you bite into that, you can check stock, pocket price with the Financial Time.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Can I have a (inaudible)?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Maybe not. It's been sitting here for a while. But look --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: It looks good, though.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: It is good. Fried fish, chips, a bit of lemon, it is fantastic.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I might have a bite later.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: We don't seven anymore on the newspaper because of the ink. It stopped in the 1980s, but I think it's just -- COATES

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. I've already taken a bite.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Thank you. OK. Wait.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Top layer. Top layer.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I love it.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: We've got another one. This one you might like. Let's swap out.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, here you go.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Let's swap out.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Pie and mash.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, pie.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: For all our viewers, traditional British.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Can you guys see this?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I'm not a big fan of peas, but you know, I do love my peas.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I do want to taste this one.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Pie mash. Quinton (ph) says this is like traditional --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I don't have a fork.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: -- fast food -- or you've got a good excuse. Oh, she's going for it, people. We only commit in London. This is what we expect.Good? Beef? Normally, beef, right? Really good. Really good. And finally -- I mean normally that used to be served with eels, believe it or not. I know.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: An eel?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I know. And one of my kids favorite dishes, bangers and mash. In the olden days they had less pork, they had more water. So that's why it banged and made a sound. Now that's why it's called bangers and mash. This is a great dish.Hey, welcome to London, Laura. Boris, try to beat us.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Boris, I mean, look, bangers and mash. What croissant have you had today?[17:15:10] SANCHEZ: I've had a several croissants what I've -- since I've gotten here. I do got to say, you may want to trade in some of that food for some of what we had here in Paris. It's a city that's known for its restaurants, its cafes, its cuisine. I got to experience all of it firsthand and then some. CNN Saskya Vandoorne came along to see me try some of the city's most famous dishes and some that might also -- Let's do it.

utterances.speaker: SASKYA VANDOORNE, CNN SENIOR FIELD PRODUCER
utterances.sentences: Shall we? Snails.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) The garlic butter is the reason you want to --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: That too, yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Yes. They're quite slippery.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Pig's intestines is what you're eating. Do they feel like innards?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Pretty good.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Yes?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Pretty good. Yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: What part of the animal do you have to guess?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It's a foot. Is that right?

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Trotter.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: OK. Trotter.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: A plus B.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: In the C ring, it reminds me of fried Spam. Never have fried Spam?

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Were you a child of the war? I mean --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Mercy.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Calf's head.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, I can't. Oh, that was intense.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: It's delicious. SANCHEZ

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: That is delicious.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: All right, I'll turn to the rice.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: I think you will like this part better.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Yes?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: OK. Does it taste like what you imagine head tastes like?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I feel like I can taste this calf's thoughts.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: Ready for dessert?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Indeed.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) Just tap it. Hear a faint crackle there?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes. Some sounds.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: OK, you go.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: So good. So good.

utterances.speaker: VANDOORNE
utterances.sentences: It's the consistency again that is so delicious. Soft. Crazy.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Melissa Bell is back with us now. And I got to say, Melissa, I was impressed by how nothing goes to waste when it comes to French food. I had a pig's leg. I had the intestine sausage. I had calf brain.

utterances.speaker: MELISSA BELL, CNN SENIOR CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: I have to ask you, though, what did you like best? The pig's trotter or the calf's brain?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It's an unanswerable question, honestly.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Boris did it. First time in Paris, and you tasted everything that was put before you. I think that's pretty impressive.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I don't know if I did it or I attempted to do it. I'm fortunate that the editors cut out the portions where I ejected some of that stuff before I actually had to consume it. Some of it looked like roadkill, to be honest, but it was a special experience, and I'm glad I got to do it.Speaking of special experiences, a few years ago, France and Paris specifically underwent a traumatic, almost tragic moment with Notre Dame catching fire. And so much of that iconic, special, world renowned structure being diminished. And not long ago, about a month or so ago, less than a month ago, it reopened.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: It was five years ago, it had burned down. The flames coming up above Notre Dame or something. There's something that Parisians who saw it that day won't forget. We got to go back, of course, when it was reopened. Honestly, I can't recommend enough a trip to Paris as you've made to come and see Notre Dame.It is spectacular what they've done with the renovation. I think anyone who has a chance to come and have a look really must. It's really beautiful and worth the trip.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: You can feel the music thumping your chest here in Paris, where we are only about a half hour away from ringing in New Year's 2025. We should note Boston is about six and a half hours away from the New Year, but 2024 brought plenty to celebrate in that city, including an NBA championship for the Celtics, that team's 18th, that team now poised for a potential repeat. And one of the top players on that team, one of the best in the league was forward Jayson Tatum, and he joins me now moments after getting off the court playing the Toronto Raptors at the Boston Garden.Jayson, thank you so much for joining us. This game obviously was a blowout. It seemed like you guys wanted to get home early to celebrate.

utterances.speaker: JAYSON TATUM, BOSTON CELTICS
utterances.sentences: Yes, thanks for having me. It was just good to get back out on the court, obviously, coming off a tough loss the other day. So it was a great opportunity for us to respond and I think we did that.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Fantastic. I'm so grateful that you're joining us in part because I've been a fan of yours, reluctantly for some time. I am a die-hard Miami Heat fan. And watching your postseason battles against the Heat has been some of the best basketball I have ever watched.You finally got the monkey off your back this year. Bringing a championship to the city of Boston. Is that first title, that first ring of yours, your top memory of 2024?

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely. At that point it was, you know, seven years in NBA, multiple trips to the conference finals. That was my second time to the NBA Finals. And that was the only thing that was kind of left to check off of the list. And to finally accomplish something that you dream about as a kid that you've been so close to throughout your career.To do it in front of the best fans in the world, in front of your family, to do it at home, you know, is something I'll never forget. And then the parade that we had, honestly, like the two best hours of my life. And hopefully we can do it again one day.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes. It seems like you guys are having quite a season thus far and we'll see how that goes. Obviously, as we get further down the line, a lot of champagne is had after a championship. I'm wondering, are you drinking some champagne tonight?

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: I think I'm going to keep it PG tonight. I got my family in town, grandparents. I'll be at home with Deuce, probably drinking apple cider and watching the ball drop tonight. So I think I'm going to keep it PG tonight.

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: A lot of things would have to go right. I think recently he's really started to, you know, fall in love with the game on his own, right. I never wanted to, obviously, he's always around me, so he's always been at the games, always around basketball. But I never wanted to force it on him. I wanted him to, you know, organically and naturally want to go, you know, play and learn the game and -- and have fun.I think at this point, it's the most important thing is for him to have fun. And if he's blessed enough to, you know, attain some of my athletic gifts and -- and -- and fall in love with the game later on in life and stay healthy, it would be incredible to do, right. Seeing LeBron and Bronny play together, you know, something we've never seen before. So I think it's -- it's super dope to see and, you know, who knows? We'll see.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. That's a sign of -- of a great dad. Not just that you're not trying to force anything on him, but also that you didn't call traveling on him in that video that we just played. Clearly he was picking up that ball and -- and running around. Jason, I do have a rapid fire round for you really quick. Would you rather hit a game winning three or hit a hole in one?

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: A hole in one.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: All right. So let's say you're a GM. I suspect what you might do with your first pick, would you go MJ, LeBron or Kobe?

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: I am signed to Jordan brand. I love Michael Jordan, great mentor of mine. But Kobe Bryant was the reason I fell in love with the game, so I got to go Kobe.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, totally. I -- I -- I've seen how much he -- he's meant to you over the years, and -- and obviously we think of him in moments like this and his family. I -- I also wonder, would you rather have lobster rolls or St. Louis barbecue, some hometown cooking?

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: I am a St. Louis kid until the day I die, so anything St. Louis, I'm thinking. I feel like we got the best food in the country, and barbecue is at the top of that list.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I can't wait to have some myself. I -- I do want to ask, what was your top song on Spotify this year and why was it Taylor Swift?

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: I love -- shout out to Taylor Swift. I know all the Swifties. I don't know my -- I don't know my top song buzz, but Taylor Swift was on that for sure.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I appreciate you being very diplomatic. Nobody wants to draw the ire of Swifties out there. So shout out to her and her fans. Hey, Jason Tatum, thank you so much for taking time to be with us tonight. I hope you enjoy that apple cider later.

utterances.speaker: TATUM
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Happy holidays.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Thanks so much. We will see Jason again in action on Thursday in a doubleheader on our sister network, TNT. The NBA on TNT features the Celtics at the Minnesota Timberwolves at 7

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: -- at 7

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Are you kidding me? I'm hating on you right now. My son is like Jason Tatum. Jason Tatum, mom. I know. That was a great interview. Are you kidding me? They are so great. I mean, he is ridiculous. I'm still mad, though. On behalf of all of Celtics fans, I'm mad he didn't play more in the Olympics. I'm just saying he should have played every single game. I said it here. I said it here. Thank you very much. OK.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: A lot of -- a lot of folks felt that way. A lot of folks felt that way. And the crazy thing is, he's only 26 years old. He has a very bright future ahead of him. A star to watch in Jayson Tatum. COATES

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Another star to watch.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Don't laugh.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Another star to watch in Laura Coates.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Anyway, let's -- let's head over to Angola. Yes, 26. Sure. Let's head over to Angola where people in Luanda are set to bring in the New Year, honestly.CNN's Larry Madowo is there. Larry, it's getting close to midnight in that part of Africa. What's going on?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: People wear white in Angola because for us, white symbolizes purity, prosperity and peace, which are values that Angolans really embrace.

utterances.speaker: MADOWO
utterances.sentences: And the other thing you do for New Year, what happens when this clock strikes midnight in Angola?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So people are here because this is a landmark. There's going to be the fires soon. But the more traditional way we spend the New Year is embracing the family exactly at midnight to enter the year with your loved ones. And after spending time with your family, we usually go to party.

utterances.speaker: MADOWO
utterances.sentences: OK, so party at midnight. But we're still getting the party started here with some traditional dancers and music from Angola. Vamush.(MUSIC PLAYING)

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Larry, we're going to come back to you to bring in a New Year there in Luanda, one of my favorite places. I have a beautiful mentor. May she rest in peace, Eunice Carvalho (ph), who is from there as well.Coming up, though, we head back to Mississippi and Morgan Freeman's bar, because CNN's Omar Jimenez is there in all his glory. Omar, what's going on where you are? Are we going to hear you perform at all?

utterances.speaker: OMAR JIMENEZ, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Look, I showed up here again to just interview Morgan Freeman, interview some bandmates, including the Mauldin Brothers here behind me, and next thing I know, I ended up on stage. They said, you got to play with us. So I think -- I think that's what we're going to do. Mauldin Brothers, I'm on you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Let's do it.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to CNN's special live coverage of New Year's Eve. We are less than two hours away from midnight right here in London. But revelers in Times Square still have a long way to go to the ball drop. Let's check back in with Coy Wire. Coy, you have a special guest from the famous Carmine's Italian restaurant in Times Square.

utterances.speaker: COY WIRE, CNN SPORTS ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes, New Year's is all about reflecting with friends, family and food. And, oh, we got some celebration going on tonight. Listen, where I'm from in Central Pennsylvania, pork and sauerkraut is the tradition on New Year's Day. The more you eat, the better prosperity after the next year. And the more you toot, maybe.But when you're in New York, Italian food is one of the crown jewels. I am here with Carmine's owner and CEO Jeff and Chef Glenn. Chef Glenn, what are we throwing down tonight? GLENN ROLNICK, CARMINE'S NYC FAMILY STYLE ITALIAN RESTAURANT CHEF: Tonight have our special spaghetti and meatballs. Meatballs is one of our most popular dishes at Carmine's. Jeff, how many of these we sell every week, day, month, whatever? JEFFREY BANK, CARMINE'S NYC FAMILY STYLE ITALIAN RESTAURANT OWNER AND CEO: One million this year, 1 million and 12 actually after this.

utterances.speaker: ROLNICK
utterances.sentences: One million and 12.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Now, however -- how -- who -- those who've never been to Carmine's, what makes it so special?

utterances.speaker: BANK
utterances.sentences: Carmine's Family Style been around 35 years. The wow factor, Southern Italian giant portions just like this that serve four to six people. Chef Glenn will come to your table, put a little cheese on for you. You get over to Atlantic City, we've had meatball eating contests. You might be able to take down Joey Chestnut.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. I can take it down. Now, you said this is a single helping for like, four or five people, but this -- this is enough for me tonight. OK. Now, Chef, tell us, what is the secret for those watching home to a very good sauce.

utterances.speaker: ROLNICK
utterances.sentences: The secret to a good sauce is using Italian style tomatoes. Absolutely, cooking it, simmering it. Do not add sugar to your sauce. Fresh herbs and a lot of garlic and olive oil. Best way to do it, please do it that way. And our meatballs, fresh mixed meatballs, veal, beef, very slowly mixed. Very tender, very tasty.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Now, I looked up Italian traditions for New Year's, and it was throw away old things and wear red underwear for luck, love, and fertility in the New Year. Is this true?

utterances.speaker: BANK
utterances.sentences: I'm not going touch that one.

utterances.speaker: ROLNICK
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I haven't tried it.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Look, these people haven't eaten for hours. I say we make them very happy. Are you all hungry?

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Let's bring out the food. Bring it on out. We're going to have a party of celebration here. We are popping champagne, and we are serving some meatballs and spaghetti to celebrate and ring into New Year. We have our friends from Japan here all the way, our friends from Tennessee. First New Year's. You having fun, big man?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, Coy. I love how all of you said no to the fertility meatballs. It's hysterical to me. Thank you so much. We'll check back in with you very shortly. We've got so much coming up. Because aside from a good meal, there's nothing on New Year's Eve like a dance. And Boris and I got on our best dancing shoes and we headed to a studio to see if we have what it takes to become professional ballroom dancers. You decide.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Six, seven, eight.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: We're ready.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK, let's do this.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Let's get ready to humiliate ourselves live.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Five, six, seven, and basic, two basics, five, six, seven, one, two, three, side step. Here we go. Shake those booties.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Boom. And push it off. Carry on.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: What could possibly go wrong? OK.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I'm glad I agree to this.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Three.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Roll. Boom. Good.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: One, two, three.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: No, let's try one more time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Basic. Here we go.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You got it.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Let's keep forgetting there's -- there's one move that, like, I can't do. Like, my brain doesn't communicate with my feet.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: This is what you need to do, so I'm like, chopping.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Here we go bodies. Six, seven. Turn.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. No, I missed it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That's it. You done it. Yes. Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We're going to be doing the dip.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, God.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: How's your back?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Venetian salsa.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Two, two.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: OK. Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Look at us. Look at us.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You got to have fun on New Year's Eve.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: You got to sweat.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You got to sweat, otherwise you're not having fun.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Cleanse those toxins from the last year.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Is that we're doing OK?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: All the bad juju, just get it out.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Well, my whole -- my whole back is covered in the toxins of 2024, so. Hope that's good for you.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I'm -- I'm not confident.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You know what?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: We shall see.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, I think I'm ready now Boris. We're going to do this?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Indeed. Look at that.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Let's do it.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Maybe we'll find out.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Uh-oh.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Five, six, seven, and right turn, step and slide. Shimmy, step and slide. Shimmy. Basic, cross body lead. Basic.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Free salad.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Senorita Laura.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Boris Sanchez, everyone. There you go. Take it out.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: All right, Tango next.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't know about that tango next.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Boris, it may always --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I -- I have to tell folks at home. Laura was a total -- Laura was a total natural. The folks in the studio were so impressed with her dancing. I, on the other hand, thank God for the editors at CNN. There was one spin that I could not do, and I just kept getting stuck over and over and over. Everybody's sweating. The instructors are getting angry with me. I felt so terrible about it. But thank goodness for Laura. And her swift feet, those salsa moves on fire and fuego.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Boris, if -- if only they knew how long it took us to get to that point in time. Are they going to call us again? I mean, maybe it's CNN with the stars, right? And were -- we had it. We had a waltz, too. We had the waltz. The waltz was good.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes. I would love to see John Berman try that.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Come on, get out of here. Oh, thank you, Laura. I appreciate you saying that. You're too kind. You're too kind. Listen, we are just about 10 minutes away from 2025 here in Paris. About 11 minutes and 20 seconds right there. Much more of CNN special New Year's Eve coverage ahead after a quick break.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: So the Arc de Triomphe that you're seeing there, of course, one of the most impressive monuments in Paris, built by Napoleon I, meant to represent to celebrate his victory. (Inaudible) And what you're seeing there is a light and sound show ahead of what will be a spectacular fireworks play just a moment.And those lights, what we've been just watching, Boris, has been a lot about Notre Dame. We were talking about it earlier on birthplace of Gothic architecture, Paris, of course. And what we saw was that cathedral reopen after five years of being rebuilt after the fire that it destroyed. It's great pomp and circumstance. President-elect Donald Trump came over 50 heads of state and there's been a lot of that displayed just on the Arc de Triomphe. Again, like what we saw this summer during the Paris Olympics really about showcasing the city that the French like to think of as the most beautiful in the world, right, 50 million visitors a year. The most visited city in the world. And this is one of the reasons. The monuments that you see here right now, where these lights are being displayed, the monuments that you saw at the heart of the Paris Olympics over the course of the summer, this is what Paris is all about. And this light and sound display goes on for the next four and a half minutes. And then, Boris, we get the real firework display that these million people have turned out on the Champs-Elysees to watch as they do every year and spectacular it is. The French capital really rings in the New Year like few others.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: As I've learned over the last few days, Paris is truly a beautiful city. And you see it here. You -- you hear the crowd reacting to the fireworks as they are popping. And obviously with so much to offer folks around the world, this city, as you mentioned, hosting the Olympics, as we're just about four minutes away, I do wonder what's next for France, what's coming up in 2025?

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: 2025, more political turbulence, I imagine.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: We are on our first -- fourth prime minister this year. God knows what next year is going to hold for us. But clearly 2024 was all about the Olympics. We have no particular huge events coming up next year. But what we did see specifically after the Olympics was an awful lot of people coming to visit Paris who hadn't been for because it was the first time that an Olympic ceremony had been held in a city center rather than in a stadium, right.So the idea was that they showed so much of what is beautiful about this city. And there was this huge spike in tourism just afterwards. Having seen the opening ceremony, people wanted to come and see for themselves. And it is always packed with tourists. There are again this New Year's down the Champs-Elysees, you'll find a lot of French families, but there are a lot of tourists from all over the world who've come specifically to watch this firework display tonight in the French capital. It's about its architecture --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: It's about the romance of the city. You're not feeling very well, Boris, but you're here for the first time. You must have felt it --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, definitely.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: -- beautiful and romantic about it.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: And people come in to soak in that spirit. I think there's something also about its history, the revolution, its ties to the United States, right?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: The foundation United States that really attracts people. In fact, some of the most numerous tourists to come are Americans. They come every year in huge numbers for these sites, for the feeling, for the romance and for everything, that very particular feel that Paris has, even --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: -- on a chilly night like this.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: The United States oldest ally, we should point out.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: As the fireworks are slowly kicking in, we're still just over about two minutes away. The crowd here is enchanted with what we are watching. Again, this is about a million people gathered together. I keep mispronouncing it. Help me with the pronunciation. The Champs- Elysees.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: I -- I've been trying all evening, Champs-Elysees.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Champs-Elysees. Champs-Elysees.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: You got it.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I'm going to keep trying all night. I do wonder, as we get closer to about a minute 50 or so, what a traditional New Year's Eve looks like in France?

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Right. So we've been talking about the fact that on the Champs- Elysees tonight, you've got a million people. Actually, what most French people do on New Year's Eve is what they do on Christmas Eve is you are at home with your family. You drink champagne, you drink wine, you eat a lot. Some of the food you tasted only -- only yesterday, Boris.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Really? Really?

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Pig structures and all, foie gras. And you tend to have a big family dinner. It's called (inaudible). The idea is that you're up from midnight, you stay at the table until the early hours of the morning, and then you dance. That is what most people do. The million who are out here today are the brave ones who've come out to brave the cold and the elements that we have tonight, Boris --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: -- in order to watch this. The traditional thing happens at home or with friends and around a table. That is the very French way of celebrating the New Year. It's all about the food.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: So -- so as we get to about a minute left to go before the real show kicks off here in Paris, what is a traditional French dance, the Can-can. What are we -- what do you dance? What are we talking?

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: So we had a bit of Can-can down there earlier --

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.
